verses.verse: Why are times <S%H6256><s%> not laid up <S%H6845><s%> by the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>? And why do not they that know <S%H3045><s%> him see <S%H2372><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%>?
There are that remove <S%H5381><s%> the landmarks <S%H1367><s%>; They violently take away <S%H1497><s%> flocks <S%H5739><s%>, and feed them <S%H7462><s%>.
They drive away <S%H5090><s%> the ass <S%H2543><s%> of the fatherless <S%H3490><s%>; They take <S%H2254><s%> the widow <S%H490><s%>'s ox <S%H7794><s%> for a pledge <S%H2254><s%>.
They turn <S%H5186><s%> the needy <S%H34><s%> out of the way <S%H1870><s%>: The poor <S%H6041><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> all <S%H3162><s%> hide themselves <S%H2244><s%>.

Behold <S%H6501><s%>, as wild asses in the desert <S%H4057><s%> They go forth <S%H3318><s%> to their work <S%H6467><s%>, seeking diligently <S%H7836><s%> for food <S%H2964><s%>; The wilderness <S%H6160><s%> yieldeth them bread <S%H3899><s%> for their children <S%H5288><s%>.
They cut <S%H7114><s%> their provender <S%H1098><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>; And they glean <S%H3953><s%> the vintage <S%H3754><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.
They lie all night <S%H3885><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> without clothing <S%H3830><s%>, And have no covering <S%H3682><s%> in the cold <S%H7135><s%>.
They are wet <S%H7372><s%> with the showers <S%H2230><s%> of the mountains <S%H2022><s%>, And embrace <S%H2263><s%> the rock <S%H6697><s%> for want of a shelter <S%H4268><s%>.
There are that pluck <S%H1497><s%> the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> from the breast <S%H7699><s%>, And take a pledge <S%H2254><s%> of the poor <S%H6041><s%>;
So that they go <S%H1980><s%> about naked <S%H6174><s%> without clothing <S%H3830><s%>, And being hungry <S%H7457><s%> they carry <S%H5375><s%> the sheaves <S%H6016><s%>.
They make oil <S%H6671><s%> within <S%H996><s%> the walls <S%H7791><s%> of these men <S%H1869><s%>; They tread their winepresses <S%H3342><s%>, and suffer thirst <S%H6770><s%>.

From out of the populous city <S%H5892><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> groan <S%H5008><s%>, And the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wounded <S%H2491><s%> crieth out <S%H7768><s%>: Yet God <S%H433><s%> regardeth <S%H7760><s%> not the folly <S%H8604><s%>.
These are of them that rebel <S%H4775><s%> against the light <S%H216><s%>; They know <S%H5234><s%> not the ways <S%H1870><s%> thereof <S%H3427><s%>, Nor abide in the paths thereof <S%H5410><s%>.

The murderer <S%H7523><s%> riseth <S%H6965><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%>; He killeth <S%H6991><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H6041><s%>; And in the night <S%H3915><s%> he is as a thief <S%H1590><s%>.

The eye <S%H5869><s%> also of the adulterer <S%H5003><s%> waiteth <S%H8104><s%> for the twilight <S%H5399><s%>, Saying <S%H559><s%>, No eye <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7789><s%> me <S%H5643><s%>: And he disguiseth his face <S%H6440><s%>.
In the dark <S%H2822><s%> they dig through <S%H2864><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%>: They shut <S%H2856><s%> themselves up in the day-time <S%H3119><s%>; They know <S%H3045><s%> not the light <S%H216><s%>.
For the morning <S%H1242><s%> is to all of them as <S%H3162><s%> thick darkness <S%H6757><s%>; For they know <S%H5234><s%> the terrors <S%H1091><s%> of the thick darkness <S%H6757><s%>.

Swiftly they pass away <S%H7031><s%> upon the face of the waters <S%H6440><s%>; Their portion <S%H2513><s%> is cursed <S%H7043><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>: They turn <S%H6437><s%> not into the way <S%H1870><s%> of the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>.
Drought <S%H6723><s%> and heat <S%H2527><s%> consume <S%H1497><s%> the snow <S%H7950><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>: So doth Sheol <S%H7585><s%> those that have sinned <S%H2398><s%>.

The womb <S%H7358><s%> shall forget <S%H7911><s%> him <S%H7415><s%>; The worm shall feed sweetly <S%H4988><s%> on him <S%H2142><s%>; He shall be no more remembered; And unrighteousness <S%H5766><s%> shall be broken <S%H7665><s%> as a tree <S%H6086><s%>.
He devoureth <S%H7462><s%> the barren <S%H6135><s%> that beareth <S%H3205><s%> not <S%H3190><s%>, And doeth not good to the widow <S%H490><s%>.
Yet God preserveth <S%H4900><s%> the mighty <S%H47><s%> by his power <S%H3581><s%>: He riseth up <S%H6965><s%> that hath no assurance <S%H539><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>.
God giveth <S%H5414><s%> them to be in security <S%H983><s%>, and they rest <S%H8172><s%> thereon <S%H5869><s%>; And his eyes are upon their ways <S%H1870><s%>.

They are exalted <S%H7426><s%>; yet a little while <S%H4592><s%>, and they are gone <S%H4355><s%>; Yea, they are brought low, they are taken out <S%H7092><s%> of the way <S%H1870><s%> as all others <S%H5243><s%>, And are cut off as the tops <S%H7218><s%> of the ears of grain <S%H7641><s%>.
And if it be not so now <S%H645><s%>, who will prove <S%H7760><s%> me a liar <S%H3576><s%>, And make <S%H7760><s%> my speech <S%H4405><s%> nothing worth <S%H408><s%>?
